# Summary of the new feature/enhancement

When you want to list dependencies for package using this command:
```Powershell
(get-package -provider Nuget -name System.memory | select dependencies).dependencies
```
result is list of dependencies and you can see lot of duplicates.
```Powershell
nuget:System.Buffers/4.4.0
nuget:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.Unsafe/4.5.2
nuget:System.Buffers/4.4.0
nuget:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.Unsafe/4.5.2
nuget:System.Buffers/4.4.0
nuget:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.Unsafe/4.5.2
nuget:System.Buffers/4.4.0
nuget:System.Numerics.Vectors/4.4.0
nuget:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.Unsafe/4.5.2

nuget:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.Unsafe/4.5.2
nuget:System.Buffers/4.4.0
nuget:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.Unsafe/4.5.2
```
Reason is that this command retrieves list of all dependencies regardless of platform/target Framework. Simply it puts it all in one basket.
However [nuget is showing dependencies based on platform/framework](https://www.nuget.org/packages/System.Memory/#)

**.NETCoreApp 2.0**
System.Runtime.CompilerServices.Unsafe (>= 4.5.2)
**.NETCoreApp 2.1**
No dependencies.
**.NETFramework 4.5**

**.NETFramework 4.6.1**

**.NETStandard 2.0**

System.Numerics.Vectors (>= 4.4.0)
System.Runtime.CompilerServices.Unsafe (>= 4.5.2)
...

# Proposed technical implementation details (optional)

Dependencies should be returned as table, for each platform/framework
with fields "Provider","Name","RequiredVersion","Platform"
then I can query result with 
```Powershell
where -Platform -eq ".NETCoreApp 2.0" 
```
which will return 1 dependency only
